name: Lidded Pot-pourri Vase (vase or pot-pourri vaisseau à mât, deuxième grandeur)
maker: Painting on front panel attributed to Charles-Nicolas Dodin, Reserve scenes after engravings by Jacques-Philippe Le Bas, after paintings by David Teniers the Younger, et al
description: Lidded Pot-pourri Vase (vase or pot-pourri vaisseau à mât, deuxième grandeur); Painting on front panel attributed to Charles-Nicolas Dodin (French, 1734 - 1803), Reserve scenes after engravings by Jacques-Philippe Le Bas (French, 1707 - 1783), after paintings by David Teniers the Younger (Flemish, 1610 - 1690), et al; Sèvres, France; about 1760; Soft paste porcelain; pink and green ground colors; polychrome enamel decoration and gilding; 37.5 x 34.8 x 17.3 cm (14 3/4 x 13 11/16 x 6 13/16 in.); 75.DE.11; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
title: Lidded Pot-pourri Vase (vase or pot-pourri vaisseau à mât, deuxième grandeur)
medium: Soft paste porcelain; pink and green ground colors; polychrome enamel decoration and gilding
